Resources & Professional Insights

Expert analysis and commentary on forensic economics, business valuation, and economic damage calculations for legal professionals.

Stay informed about the latest developments in forensic economics and business valuation with our expert insights, case law updates, and methodology discussions.

Professional Calculation Tools

Interactive tools designed for attorneys and legal professionals to assist with economic damage calculations and analysis.

Life Expectancy Lookup Tool

Comprehensive tool for calculating life expectancy, work life expectancy, and years to final separation based on demographic data. Enter birth date and injury date once to get all calculations automatically.

  • Life Expectancy (LE) based on gender, race, and age
  • Work Life Expectancy (WLE) based on education and activity status
  • Years to Final Separation (YFS) calculations
  • Flexible date input formats
Access Tool

External Professional Resources

Access authoritative data and professional organizations relevant to forensic economics and business valuation.

Government Data Sources

  • Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS)

    Labor statistics, wage data, employment projections, and economic indicators

  • Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA)

    National economic accounts, GDP data, and regional economic statistics

  • U.S. Department of Labor (DOL)

    Labor laws, FLSA regulations, workplace statistics, and employment standards

Professional Organizations

  • International Association of Rehabilitation Professionals (IARP)

    Resources for life care planning and vocational rehabilitation

  • American Rehabilitation Economics Association (AREA)

    Professional standards and methodologies for economic damage calculations

  • National Association of Forensic Economics (NAFE)

    Research, publications, and professional development in forensic economics

Additional Resources

  • Social Security Administration - Office of the Chief Actuary

    Life expectancy tables, wage indices, and retirement statistics

  • Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED)

    Economic research data including interest rates and inflation indices

  • U.S. Census Bureau

    Demographic data, income statistics, and household information

Peer-Reviewed Academic Journals

Access leading scholarly research in forensic economics and business valuation from these prestigious academic publications.

Links reviewed: December 2024

Forensic Economics Journals

  • Journal of Forensic Economics National Association of Forensic Economics
  • Journal of Legal Economics American Academy of Economic & Financial Experts
  • The Earnings Analyst American Rehabilitation Economics Association
  • Litigation Economics Review NAFE Archives on JSTOR (Subscription Required)

Business Valuation Journals

  • Journal of Business Valuation and Economic Loss Analysis De Gruyter
  • Business Valuation Review American Society of Appraisers
  • Valuation Studies Linköping University Electronic Press
  • The Appraisal Journal Appraisal Institute

Finance & Economics Journals

  • Journal of Applied Corporate Finance Wiley
  • Journal of Business Finance & Accounting Wiley
  • Journal of Corporate Finance Elsevier
  • Journal of Financial Economics Elsevier
  • Journal of Risk and Financial Management MDPI
  • The Journal of Entrepreneurial Finance Pepperdine University
  • Journal of Property Investment & Finance Emerald Publishing
